H0.text: The anode is the electrode at which oxidation occurs.

H1.text: Diode is the electrode at which oxidation occurs.

H2.text: Cathode is the electrode at which oxidation occurs.

H3.text: Calomel is the electrode at which oxidation occurs.

A4.text: In electrochemistry, the anode is where oxidation occurs and is the positive polarity contact in an electrolytic cell.

A5.text: In both a galvanic cell and an electrolytic cell, the anode is the electrode at which the oxidation reaction occurs.

A6.text: In chemistry, a cathode is the electrode of an electrochemical cell at which reduction occurs.

A7.text: The anodic current is the flow of electrons into the anode from a species in solution.

A8.text: reduction occurs at the cathode and the anode is for oxidation

A9.text: the cathode is the electrode of an electrochemical cell at which reduction occurs
